Description: A UFO. It had bright red, blue and orange flashing lights, in the shape of a tri-angle. Remained stationary for 15 minutes.
Small blobs of rings with a larger ring around them. White and very bright. Stationary.
One dome shaped object. Very dark. Was directly above and moving slowly.
One, silver, fountain pen shaped object, described as an aircraft without wings.
One white/very bright object. Moving vertically, then remained stationary, with occasional bursts of light. Seen for over an hour.
There was a light through the witness's window, which seemed to be quite a distance away, and moving slowly.
Looked like a bright orange tear drop shaped object, that appeared to have lightning coming from its sides.
One opal shaped object with lights, that were orange, red, blue and white. Was very bright.
One object, the shape of a star. Triangular red lights. There were also yellow and blue rays. Was hovering. Pulsated and then vanished.
A bright, green light was moving at very high speed. The object appeared to land near Kegworth over the M1
Silver ball, really bright. Was lower than an aircraft and moving in a straight line. (Message taken 17 Feb 2001).
Two semi circular, elliptical shapes dully illuminated yellow and white. There was a faint murmur.
Green light coming down from the sky, had never seen anything like it before.
There were three hanging silver rods. They were drifting slowly, then became bright silver and then faded away.
Large flying object, witness had never seen anything like it before. No lights whatsoever.
Series of eight to ten lights all tracing a pattern in the sky.
A ball of light, with no colour, passed under an aircraft, front to back, very fast.
Saw a black triangle flying quite fast and silently, through the sky in a single direction.
A stationary triangular object was seen. The object remained stationary for about 30 minutes at quite a height.
The object was cigar shaped, grey in colour with domed ends, was silent and very slow.
Two circular objects, about half the apparent size of the moon, that were a very dull yellow.
Bright as Mars. White light. Dim brightness. Moved in a South East direction.
Nothing was seen, but a loud noise was heard, like a balloon letting out air.
A loud noise like a hot air balloon was heard, but nothing was seen.
Four dull red lights above the house, travelling fast and low.
Two objects were both an orange colour and were disc shaped. They looked like aircraft without wings and were very silent.
Saw a big orange disc going from East to West. Said the object was totally silent and moving quite slowly.
A bright light was seen heading towards the earth through the clouds.
Looked like an orange ball of light, like a big star in the sky and it had spiderish legs.
Light bulbs in the sky. (From the Scarborough Evening Post).
Witnessed a V shaped object, which had bright lights, and sounded like bees.
A group of lights in the sky were moving erratically to the West. They just seemed to fade away.
A massive light. The object was shaped like an iron. Didn't move at all.
A white light was moving slow in the direction of Hull like it was floating, but it stopped after a couple of minutes.
Silver ball that was stationary and then disappeared in to a cloud.
Was a small white object, that was moving parallel with an airliner.
The object looked like a rod. Through binoculars it appeared to shine silver, but was grey to the naked eye. Was moving around.
A UFO, Shooting Star or something was seen, couldn't really make out what it was! Was bright blue/white in colour.
Very bright lights were seen for over half an hour. They were hovering quite slowly from side to side.
There were two spheres and one was following the other. Looked like they were moving from side to side.
A large, round, white object, with smaller, round white objects randomly scattered surrounding it. The objects started to fade.
Slim, flat object like a plate, or pencil, lengthways. Circular light at either end and bigger in the centre. Stationary for 1-2 minutes.
There was a convoy of white lights moving along the river bank. They were silent.

The object looked like a low flying cloud, but there was a light flashing on it. The 
object was moving at a 100ft above ground level, and slowly across the sky.

Sixty orange glowing lights were seen, going across the sky in a trail. They were 
moving quite slowly.

A bright, white light was seen, moving in a North Easterly direction, on a slow even 
course. Was about 2000ft up in the sky.

A ball that lit up and that lasted half a second. Then a really tiny star moved 
rapidly, faster than any satellite or aircraft the witness had seen.

A silver disc was seen, with an orange light in the middle of it. The object was 
flying up and down in the sky.

There were ten to twenty, bright orange lights, 
that were manoeuvring across the sky. They 
were moving quite slowly.

There was a craft that had green, red and 
white lights. It was still and static in the sky. It 
was seen for about an hour and a half.

A bright orange light was seen. It started to 
move backwards, up and down and then 
started to wobble to and fro, very fast. It faded 
away, as though it was moving into the 
distance.

Ten to fifteen lights in groups of twos and 
threes, moving across the sky very slowly in 
an Easterly direction.

Lights were seen in the sky, that were flying 
up in a straight line. They were completely 
silent.

A strange object was seen in the sky. It was 
around for several minutes, and then flew off.

There were five orange objects and then one 
orange 'blob' came into view.

An object that had a flat top and a rounded 
bottom. It was roughly the width of a 
combined semi detached house. There was a 
dim humming sound.

There was a quite low, red and an orange 
light. A bright, phosphorus white light fell from 
the orange light towards the ground, before 
disappearing. The red light was static 
throughout the sighting.

Two, red round lights. The objects were 
moving across the sky in different directions 
and then just disappeared.

A silent aircraft passed overhead. It was 
clearly visible like a shooting star, but with a 
smooth curving course.

Oval shaped, weird light in the sky. The object 
moved from right to left and was moving in a 
Westerly direction.

A triangle shaped object, which had three 
white lights and one red light. There was no 
noise.

Twenty to twenty five lights were moving 
across the sky. They were in a uniformed 
lighting formation.

A red light slow moving in the sky. The object 
was not terribly high up.

One single round light. It was orange/red in 
colour. It was moving South East. There was 
no sound at all.

Two bright lights. It looked like a spectrum of 
light shone through the car.

Three bright orange lights/objects in the sky, 
about a mile away. One of the objects was 
black and disc shaped. It moved quick and 
was silent.

Two objects that both had two lights on them. 
Each object was moving independently from 
the other. There was no sound.

There was a bright yellow light in the sky. The 
object was approximately 12,000 ft up.

Fifty nine lights in the sky that formed a 'V' 
shape. There were a few lights on their own. 
They were bright red and very big. They were 
silent.

The craft had bright green lights and a blue 
light that was moving quickly through the 
trees. It was very large and was moving 
extremely fast. It was silent.

Two large orange lights in the sky, were flying 
East rather quickly. One light flew around the 
other one, then they both moved away North, 
at a higher speed.

An object, the shape of a chewing gum pack, 
black in colour and had three circles of lights 
underneath it, emitting a dull orange light. 
Was about 150 feet long and 50 feet wide.

There were five, what looked like strange 
orange fire balls. They were silent.

A very bright light, which had a long white tail. 
It then shot across the sky and the whole field 
was lit up. The light then began to break up.

An orange ball. The object was stationary for 
about five minutes and then shot up into the 
sky, and out of view. There was no sound.

Seven strange orange lights. Moving at great 
speed. Appeared one by one and remained 
stationary for 30 minutes before disappearing.

Bright orange/yellow light in the sky. Quite 
large, 1500-2000 ft up. Moved very slowly in a 
half circle then stopped over the water 
between Brightlingsea & East Mersea. Shot 
straight up and dissappeared very fast.

Over my house. It was massive. Unbelievable. The noise was 
incredible. I thought we were under nuclear attack.

Five yellow/orange objects in formation. Moving east to west. Slow 
but straight flight.

A bright flaming object, about a quarter of the size of the moon. It 
was like a special effect. It was silent and went from horizon to 
horizon, starting in the North.

Like a large black parachute with nothing suspended from it. It 
changed shape and gradually got smaller as it went into the 
distance. Observed for 10-20 minutes.

A long shaped vehicle with a red light at the front and two gold lights 
either side. Hovered above the house and then moved off to the 
right at tremendous speed before returning. It then drifted slowly 
away. It was louder than a plane or helicopter.

A large black ball with a light underneath. Travelling South over 
western Bury St Edmunds at 3000ft at 200 miles an hour.

A bright green light that whizzed about the sky for an hour. It was 
very fast and a few planes got in its way.

Saw orange lights that looked like flames. They were heading South 
to North towards Preston. Police said it was the open rear of an 
aircraft undertaking parachute training.

Six very bright orange lights flying in formation passed by in 15 
minutes. Heading from Upper Norwood towards Crystal Palace.

Initially one then five pitch black hot air balloon shaped objects with 
continual flames underneath.

A large bright yellow object hovering in the sky. Too bright to be an 
aircraft and the wrong colour. It didn't move for ages and then 
disappeared in the blink of an eye.

A slow moving, silent, orangey/red light. Does not think it was a 
helicopter or aircraft. Flew at same height as a helicopter.

A UFO over the witnesses house. It was at 30,000ft and he has seen 
it before.

A diamond shaped orange light. If you held out your hand it would 
have been the size of a 20p coin. It was totally silent. The object 
carried on in the distance and then another one appeared and 
followed the same path.

8-10 bright red lights. They were hovering. They moved 
independently into the distance and disappeared when a light aircraft 
appeared.

Seven bright orange lights in the sky. Silent. Travelling towards the 
Wirral.
A big bright light. Came from west Cornwall towards Plymouth.

An ellipse shaped object the size of a commercial plane. It was on 
fire. It glowed bright orange. It moved South East to North and then 
returned and hovered for at least a minute. Moved further away at 
supersonic speed.

Very strange circular objects without definite shape. They stayed 
around for about five minutes. They were 8-9 of them.

Ten orange lights in a line with intermittent gaps. They made no 
sound and flew at helicopter height.

Three distinct sets of green, orange and white lights. Don't match 
any constellation and are in the wrong place. Static to the eye but 
with binoculars are moving at speed and at random.

Was watching shooting stars when the witness saw two bright 
luminous orange objects like birds or swans. Does not think they 
were birds as they moved too fast.

An orange light. Light(s) travelled in formation like a mis-shaped 
diamond. There were 12-13 of them. They travelled left to right.

Red objects moving slowly. They were not high and were silent. 
Might have been going over Bakewell.

Ball of light. No noise. Bright light, rising behind a fence, went up 
into the sky.

A large bright silver/white ball/sphere. Moving slowly W to E. the 
object was much bigger and brighter than an aircraft. It appeared to 
stop still several times as it went into the distance. The light did not 
dim as it moved further away.

Very bright, very big, not a satellite, not a plane, stationary. Light 
disappeared.

Bright star, went from bright yellow to bright red. Did not look like a 
shooting star or plane. Moved no more than 2-3 feet.

Three bright orange lights, not flashing. Very big, high up, set 
equally apart. Reported it to RAF Northolt. Never saw anything like 
this before.

A UFO of orangey/red colour. It hovered and moved slightly in the 
direction of Stroud, then suddenly dropped downwards.

A bright, reddish light travelling W to E, below cloud level. It made 
no sound. It was moving in a straight line but too slow to be a 
meteorite. It had no navigation type lights.

10-12 bright orange objects, silent. Has a photo of them saved on 
his mobile.
Six yellow lights, stationary at first then moved off.

Four-five orange lights, fluctuating lights. Lives under flight path of 
Donnington airfield. Objects moved in a line. Lights faded. Returned 
10 minutes later.

Video footage in Cornwall near an Air Station (possibly Culdrose). 
Five minute sighting.

Large round object. Two planes flew round it. Could be something 
natural, such as an eclipse.

Light seen in sky also above this was a large round shape which 
looked rocky and was blue and pink in colour.

15 to 20 orange and red lights looked as though they were coming 
down to land but then went over head and 'went out'.

Round shape - lightening then darkening with a dark shape behind it.  
No engine noise.
Saw a bright light heading towards Essex - bright light standing still.

Orange ball going in a straight line.  No visible trail.  No smoke or 
noise. Appeared to be getting smaller burning itself up.
Saw what looked like a flying log, blue with a white edge.

Terrestrials seen coming from King's Lynn towards Swaffham, 
Norfolk.

Two glowing sphere/domed -shaped objects followed each in South 
East direction.  Completely silent and not flashing at all, as you 
would expect from aircraft.

One object rising in the sky. Semi circle outline. Flames glowing 
orange/red.  Flickering round the edge. At first thought it was a 
firework, then it disappeared.

Orange lights following each other in same direction. No noise, no 
flashing lights, same trajectory. In vicinity of Lyneham radar.  Some 
lights disappeared.

Semi-circle of light, golden orange, moved off towards the east.  No 
noise heard.

Saw 25 to 30 bright orange lights in the sky - Flying in a triangular 
shape.
Fifteen to twenty bright vertical line going slowly - no noise.

Five, really bright orange flame ball type objects seen flying across 
the sky, moving irregularly. One moving faster than a plane and one 
zig-zagged down towards the ground then reappeared after the other 
four had moved across the sky and had gone.

Thirty orange globes, in four waves, travelling at a constant speed. 
May have been lanterns of some kind but they would have been 1-2 
Metres in diameter.

Saw Orange flamed lights, in formation slowly and silently across 
the night sky.
